author: Canadian Press
title: Friends and family mourn the loss of Canadians killed by Hamas in Israel
text:
Friends, family and government officials have confirmed that at least seven Canadians were killed when Hamas militants conducted a series of attacks in Israel on Oct. 7.
Global Affairs Canada has said an eighthperson who was not a citizen but had deep ties to Canada also died in the ensuing conflict. Another Canadian, who has not been identified, died in Lebanon during the hostilities.
The Hamas attacks killed an estimated 1,200 people and militants took another 240 hostage, 105 of whom were released during a temporary pause in the violence at the end of last month.
As Israel continues its retaliation on Hamas in the Gaza Strip, authorities there say more than 20,000 Palestinians have now been killed.
Here's what we know about the Hamas victimswith ties to Canada:
Judih Weinstein Haggai
Judih Weinstein Haggai, 70, was out on an early-morning walk when Hamas started its attack, her family says.
She told members of her Nir Oz kibbutz that a militant on a motorcycle shot her husband and she was less severely wounded. The community was unable to dispatch an ambulance before militants arrived there.
Last week, the kibbutz confirmed Gadi Haggai, Judih's husband, died on Oct. 7, and on Thursday they confirmed Weinstein Haggai also died that day, and her body is being held in Gaza.
Weinstein Haggai was born in New York state but arrived in Toronto at the age of three, and moved to Israel 20 years later to live with her husband. She held Canadian, Israeli and American citizenships.
Weinstein Haggai was an artist and a volunteer who the kibbutz said "pursued many initiatives to advance peace in the region."
Her brother Larry Weinstein said the family is distressed by Israel's offensive in Gaza and the rise of hateful speech in Canada toward both Jews and Muslims.
"We're inspired by my sister, who believed in peace and believed in harmony," he said. "There can't be any kind of resolution when people are at each other's throats."
Vivian Silver
Vivian Silver, 74, was in her home on Kibbutz Be'eri near the Gaza border and talking on the phone with her son Yonatan Zeigen when they learned of the incursion by Hamas into Israel.
"We couldnâ€™t grasp the incapability of the Israeli army to defend the civilians â€¦ we started to say goodbye because we realized this is probably our last words to each other," Zeigen later told a news conference organized by the Jerusalem Press Club.
He said they shifted their conversations to text messages so his mother could stay silent, and someone broke into her home. They said they loved one another before the messages stopped coming.
Zeigen said he had received information that she was taken hostage, and her phone had been geolocated in Gaza.
On Monday, his brother Chen Zeigen confirmed their mother's death. He said Israeli authorities told him the remains found earlier in the kibbutz had been identified as Silver.
He said his mother was born in Winnipeg and moved to Israel in 1974.
She dedicated her life to peacebuilding and fostering understanding between Israelis and Palestinians, he added.
She also volunteered to help children in Gaza access medical care in Israel.
Tiferet Lapidot
Tiferet Lapidot, 22, was a few days shy of her 23rd birthday and attending a music festival when the Hamas attack began.
Her cousin Oran Zlotnik remembered Lapidot as a charismatic and compassionate person who had travelled the world, taught in Africa and spent time in Australia before she returned to Israel in the fall.
Her uncle Harel Lapidot said she called her mother the morning of the attack to say she was hiding in a bush and to ask whether she should flee. Her cellphone was later tracked to the Gaza Strip, leading family to believe she was being held hostage. They then mounted a campaign to secure her freedom.
Zlotnik said that when the cellphone of one of Lapidot's friends, confirmed deceased, was also traced to Gaza, the family realized it was possible she wasn't a hostage.
Harel Lapidot said his niece's body was later identified and the family held a funeral.
"We know for a fact they were hunted," he said. "They ran away and they were hunted and killed."
Tiferet Lapidot was an Israeli citizen but her family was from Canada, including her father, Ohad, who was born in Saskatchewan.
Harel Lapidot thanked the Jewish community in Canada and MPs who had reached out to help and offer support. The family had a meeting with Foreign Affairs Minister MÃ©lanie Joly while she was in Israel.
Netta Epstein
Israeli-Canadian Netta Epstein, 21, died when his home, Kibbutz Kfar Aza, came under attack.
His mother, Ayelet Shachar-Epstein, said he loved life. She learned the circumstances of his death from text messages he sent her in the moments before he was killed, and from his fiancÃ©e, Irene Shavit, who survived.
Netta Epstein was inside a safe room with Shavit, and he jumped on a grenade thrown in by the attackers.
Shachar-Epstein, who also lost her mother-in-law and two brothers-in-law in the attacks, described it as a terrorist invasion.
She said her son, who had worked with special needs youth, had returned home two months earlier after completing military service.
He was born in Montreal and was a Canadian citizen. Shachar-Epstein said many members of the family still live in that city.
Shir Georgy
Israeli Canadian Shir Georgy, 22, was killed by Hamas militants who ambushed the music festival near Kibbutz Re'im.
Georgy's aunt Michal Bouganim confirmed the death.
"We are currently a mess, heartbroken," Bouganim said in a Facebook message.
Bouganim shared a 22-second clip on her social media in which a terrified Georgy was seen sitting on a floor, with her back against a wall and surrounded by other festival attendees â€” some of them injured.
Georgy's funeral was held in Israel.
Adi Vital-Kaploun
Adi Vital-Kaploun, 33, was killed by Hamas militants in her kibbutz near the Israeli border with the Gaza Strip, said the Jewish Federation of Ottawa.
The group's CEO made a statement on behalf of Vital-Kaploun's family, saying the dual citizen has a large extended family in the Ottawa area.
The family said she died a hero, after convincing her killers to spare her two young children and warning her father and husband to stay hidden during the attack.
"Adi was a beautiful woman that brought love and lightness to the people around her, but also she was very focused and determined to make a beautiful life for her family," her cousin-in-law Aaron Smith said in an interview.
The family said she was an amazing mother and wife, always bringing love and laughter to their household.
She was also a talented dancer, saxophonist and basketball player.
After completing her master's degree in engineering, Vital-Kaploun excelled in her cybersecurity career, they said.
"We are mourning trying to process this unconscionable act of terrorism in her kibbutz and across the country," said the family, adding that they wish her memory to be "a blessing."
Ben Mizrachi
Canadian Ben Mizrachi was one of at least 260 people gunned down by Hamas militants at the music festival in southern Israel.
Mizrachi, 22, from Vancouver, was described as "larger than life with a big personality" in a statement by his former high school in B.C.
Ezra Shanken, CEO of the Jewish Federation of Greater Vancouver, said Mizrachi was about to start university in Israel after serving with the country's national defence force.
Hilit Nurick, a home economics teacher at King David High School in Vancouver, remembered Mizrachi as a "kind, wonderful, and community-minded" young man who had a positive influence on everyone around him.
Nurick said she and Mizrachi once put a large event together for more than 100 people at school.
"He was in charge of making Moroccan-style spicy fish stew. He brought his mother's recipe and shared it with everyone and taught us how to make it," said Nurick. "He was incredible, just an incredible human being."
Alexandre Look
Alexandre Look, who had recently celebrated his 33rd birthday, was among those killed while attending the musical festival.
Look, who lived in Montreal with his family before moving to Mexico, died a hero, his dad said in a Facebook post.
"Like a true warrior he left as a hero wanting to protect the people he was with," Alain Haim Look said.
Friend Lior Horovitz described him as a "once-in-a-lifetime person" who became like family during their five-year friendship.
In a phone interview from a town outside Tel Aviv, she said she and her boyfriend met Alexandre Look in Mexico. They became fast friends and would organize their vacations to meet up, either in Mexico or Israel.
He was a proud Jewish Canadian and a generous person who would do anything for his friends, she said.
"He's a person who loves people," she said. "He's the guy that's always going to help others, especially if they are Jewish."
This report by The Canadian Press was first published Dec. 28, 2023.
The Canadian Press

title: Caso Ayotzinapa: Giran nuevas Ã³rdenes de aprehensiÃ³n contra tres militares que habÃ­an obtenido libertad condicional
text:
La FiscalÃ­a General de la RepÃºblica ( FGR ) informÃ³ que obtuvo de un juez nuevas Ã³rdenes de aprehensiÃ³n contra tres de los 8 militares acusados de la desapariciÃ³n de los 43 normalistas de Ayotzinapa , que habÃ­an quedado en libertad condicional el pasado 24 de enero.
Tras esa decisiÃ³n, la FGR informÃ³ que apelarÃ­a la decisiÃ³n y rechazÃ³ el cambio de medida cautelar , mientras tanto, estas nuevas Ã³rdenes son por el delito de delincuencia organizada, por lo que volverÃ­an tras las rejas por prisiÃ³n preventiva oficiosa.
Militares habrÃ­an obtenido su libertad condicional El pasado miÃ©rcoles 24 de enero, los 8 militares detenidos por el caso Ayotzinapa abandonaron en el Campo Militar 1-A para llevar su proceso en libertad, luego de que la juez Raquel Ivette Duarte Cedillo considerÃ³ que las normas no pueden estar por encima de los tratados internacionales de derechos humanos, pues no habÃ­a justificaciones suficientes para que permanecieran encerrados.
Entre las condiciones que los militares debÃ­an cumplir para mantenerse en libertad estÃ¡n:
Entregar su pasaporte, pues tienen prohibido salir del paÃ­s. No pueden ir al estado de Guerrero. Pagar 50 mil pesos de garantÃ­a No mantener comunicaciÃ³n con testigos o vÃ­ctimas. Â¿CuÃ¡l es la presunta implicaciÃ³n de los militares en la desapariciÃ³n de los normalistas? SegÃºn el informe de la ComisiÃ³n de la verdad del caso Ayotzinapa presidida por el Subsecretario, Alejandro Encinas, fueron elementos del 27 BatallÃ³n de InfanterÃ­a quienes se encargaron de seis estudiantes que quedaron con vida la madrugada del 27 de septiembre de 2014, en Iguala, Guerrero, y presuntamente el ahora General JosÃ© RodrÃ­guez PÃ©rez habrÃ­a dado la orden de desaparecer a los 43 normalistas.
Cabe recordar que en agosto de 2022 se giraron 83 Ã³rdenes de aprehensiÃ³n, entre ellas 20 contra mandos del EjÃ©rcito y personal de tropa del 27 y 41 batallones de la ciudad de Iguala, pero estas fueron canceladas posteriormente.
Estos 8 militares forman parte del grupo de 16 uniformados en contra de quienes se giraron Ã³rdenes de aprehensiÃ³n y al estar en activo fueron detenidos de inmediato.

author: VNExplorer
title: Abuela se viraliza por disfrutar un concierto de Shinedown; â€œSentir la mÃºsica en los huesosâ€
text:
Abuela en concierto de Shinedown | TikTok
Una queja constante que se suele escuchar al asistir a un concierto es sobre el uso excesivo del telÃ©fono y que los asistentes quieran documentar toda su experiencia.
Una de las razones por las que se viralizÃ³ el video de una mujer de la tercera edad disfrutando de forma eufÃ³rica un concierto, es no sÃ³lo por los aÃ±os de la persona sino por el hecho de vivir el momento en lugar de solo estar documentando el show.
AsÃ­ viviÃ³ el momento la abuela en el concierto de Shinedown
Fue a travÃ©s de TikTok que se ha viralizado el momento exacto de una mujer mayor disfrutando de la forma mÃ¡s eufÃ³rica posible, un concierto de la banda de rock estadunidense Shinedown.
El clip solo dura unos cuantos segundos pero fue suficiente para que las personas lo compartieran a travÃ©s de otras redes sociales, pues se ve a una persona mayor corear y bailar la canciÃ³n de â€˜Sound of Madnessâ€™.
El video no sÃ³lo asombra por la edad de la persona, sino mÃ¡s bien por la actitud que tiene en pleno concierto la vitalidad y energÃ­a con la canta el tema de la banda de rock.
El video se hizo tan viral que las reacciones llegaron hasta la persona del video la cual lleva el nombre de Lauri Norris, la cual subiÃ³ un video a su cuenta de TikTok, agradeciendo todos los comentarios bonitos que le han dejado.
â€œSolo querÃ­a tomarme un minuto para decir lo humilde y empoderado que he estado por todos sus comentarios en lÃ­nea. Todo lo que puedo decir es: vive mejor tu vida, vive mejor tus sueÃ±os y espero verte en la carreteraâ€, dijo.
Al entrar a su cuenta personal se descubre que ella es una amante de la mÃºsica rock, por lo que usualmente asiste a conciertos y su forma de disfrutar la mÃºsica es por lo que ahora sus videos se han popularizado en internet.
En otro clip incluso se puede ver en otro video que ella ha subido otra perspectiva del mismo concierto, donde se le observa caminar con su andadera hacia el escenario y uno de los guitarristas de la banda se acerca a cantar con ella.
AquÃ­ el video de ella cantando con el guitarrista Estas son las reacciones de los usuarios El video ya cuenta con mÃ¡s de 7 millones de reproducciones y alrededor de 600 mil me gustas, ademÃ¡s los usuarios han dejado miles de comentarios bonitos hacia la mujer.
Muchos apuntan a lo responsable que ha sido al usar tapones para los oÃ­dos para que su audiciÃ³n no se vea afectada, otros aseguran que esa es la forma correcta de vivir un concierto.
AdemÃ¡s, los comentarios no han sido lo Ãºnico positivo pues incluso una usuarios ha salido a presumir que ha hecho una taza con la imagen de la persona disfrutado el show en vivo.
â€œDisfrutando al cien y sin tener celular en manoâ€
â€œNo me canso de verla, SU ENERGIAAAâ€
â€œMientras respiremos, hay que ser felices.. el envase envejece pero el espÃ­ritu jamÃ¡sâ€
â€œSe nota que lo disfruta mÃ¡s que los que estÃ¡n a su alrededorâ€
â€œEs que asÃ­ se debe disfrutar un concierto, cantar, bailar, sentir la mÃºsica en los huesosâ€
â€œEnvejece el cuerpo, pero jamÃ¡s el almaâ€
â€œEL ROCK ROMPIENDO LAS BARRERAS DEL TIEMPOâ€.
Mira aquÃ­ el video la mujer disfrutando el concierto â€‹

author: Fran Besora
title: Confirmado: iOS 18 hace que tu iPhone se reinicie automÃ¡ticamente cada 3 dÃ­as

author: @andaluciainf
title: La familia de uno de los soldados muertos en Cerro Muriano denuncia al capitÃ¡n y mandos | AndalucÃ­a InformaciÃ³n. Todas las noticias de Sevilla
text: La familia del soldado Carlos LeÃ³n Rico, de 24 aÃ±os, natural de El Viso del Alcor (Sevilla) y fallecido recientemente junto con el cabo Miguel Ãngel JimÃ©nez AndÃºjar en unas maniobras en la base de la Brigada GuzmÃ¡n el Bueno X de Cerro Muriano, en CÃ³rdoba, se ha personado en las diligencias previas incoadas por el asunto por el Juzgado de InstrucciÃ³n NÃºmero Cuatro de CÃ³rdoba y prevÃ© formalizar este viernes su denuncia contra el capitÃ¡n responsable del ejercicio y sus tres superiores inmediatos. El letrado Luis Romero, que representa a la familia del difunto soldado Carlos LeÃ³n Rico, ha informado de que la denuncia se dirige contra dicho capitÃ¡n, retirado del mando por el EjÃ©rcito de Tierra a cuenta de los hechos; el teniente coronel inmediatamente superior a Ã©l, un coronel y un general, con peticiÃ³n de que todos ellos sean llamados como investigados al procedimiento judicial. Las diligencias previas, segÃºn el letrado, giran en torno a dos presuntos delitos de homicidio imprudente, toda vez que ambos efectivos fallecieron ahogados en un lago de la base, realizando un ejercicio prÃ¡ctico. SegÃºn la AsociaciÃ³n de Tropa y MarinerÃ­a EspaÃ±ola (ATME), este suceso saldado con la muerte por ahogamiento de dos militares de tropa del Regimiento de InfanterÃ­a La Reina 2 y otros dos hospitalizados por hipotermia "se produjo sobre las 9,00 horas, con una temperatura muy baja, mientras se realizaba ejercicio de paso de cursos de agua con equipo completo en el embalse situado en el Campo de Maniobras" de la base de la Brigada GuzmÃ¡n el Bueno X. En dicho ejercicio "participaban, entre otros, los nuevos militares que se habÃ­an incorporado hacÃ­a pocos meses del Centro de FormaciÃ³n, los cuales, a la finalizaciÃ³n de este, recibirÃ­an la tradicional boina de la unidad", segÃºn ha precisado ATME. La asociaciÃ³n ha solicitado "informaciÃ³n sobre el nÃºmero de horas, recogidas en el Plan de InstrucciÃ³n, que realizÃ³ el personal de nueva incorporaciÃ³n que participaba en el ejercicio, con el fin de aprender los procedimientos que se deberÃ­an poner en prÃ¡ctica para saber reaccionar en las situaciones ambientales en que se realizÃ³ el ejercicio dentro del embalse". TambiÃ©n quiere saber la asociaciÃ³n de militares profesionales, "si el ejercicio de paso de cursos de agua estaba recogido en la programaciÃ³n de las maniobras y quÃ© medidas de seguridad y sanitarias se tomaron", tales como la "presencia de ambulancia, de mÃ©dico, de sanitarios, etcÃ©tera". EnvÃ­a tu noticia a: [participa@andaluciainformacion.es](mailto:participa@andaluciainformacion.es)

author: Nikole Behrens
title: 'DWTS' Gleb Savchenko & Brooks Nader Take Things To Next Level
text:
During the course of Dancing With The Stars Season 33, Gleb Savchenko and Brooks Nader caused quite a stir among fans. At first, viewers strongly believed the two were embroiled in the middle of a scandalous showmance. But as time went on, it seemed they sincerely seemed to care for each other.
After some chaotic TikTok drama, Gleb and Brooks reunited for the DWTS Season 33 finale, where they performed alongside Jenn Tran and Sasha Farber .
In a new social media post, it seems like Brooks and Gleb have taken their relationship to the next level as they spent the Christmas holidays together.
Brooks Nader & Gleb Savchenko Kept Their Love Alive Off The Dance Floor Dancing With The Stars viewers werenâ€™t at all surprised to see Gleb and Brooks flirting on social media and onscreen. However, few thought their showmance would blossom into something greater.
Season 33 ended a month ago, but Brooks Nader and Gleb Savchenko are still spending quite a bit of time together.
Gleb Savchenko/Instagram Now, theyâ€™re even spending time with each otherâ€™s families. Gleb got a chance to know Brooksâ€™ sisters during rehearsals for Dedication Night. But the Russian dancer decided it was time his new girlfriend met his daughters.
â€œ I donâ€™t need anything else â™¾ï¸â€ Gleb shared on Instagram . In the first photo, he poses with his oldest daughter, Olivia. But as the slides continue, Brooks Nader appears. In the fourth photo, Gleb snapped a picture of Brooks and Olivia strolling down the sidewalk together.
Itâ€™s not immediately clear when Gleb decided to introduce his new girlfriend to his children. However, Olivia and Brooks appear to be close already.
View this post on Instagram
A post shared by Gleb Savchenko (@glebsavchenkoofficial)
DWTS Fans React To The Photo Dump Several Instagram users raised eyebrows at Glebâ€™s caption, noting his youngest daughter Zlata wasnâ€™t present in the photos. More than likely, she was with her mother, Elena Samodanova . But even so, it seemed like an odd choice of words when both his children couldnâ€™t be present.
Zlataâ€™s absence aside, other fans thought the photos were incredibly sweet. At first, they found Gleb and Brooksâ€™ romance incredibly shallow. But now, it seems like the couple is growing on DWTS fans.
Instagram users wrote:
â€œ The hard launch weâ€™ve been waiting for ðŸ˜ðŸ˜ðŸ˜â€ â€œ I knew it was meant to be the moment you guys were partnered upâ€¦ love you both so much ðŸ˜­ðŸ«¶ðŸ¼ðŸ¤ happy holidaysâ€ â€œ Finally, what we were waiting forâ€¦. itâ€™s official!!! Imagine how cute their baby would be!!!!â€ â€œ I love this so much and hope it lastsâ€ Are you surprised to see that Brooks Nader and Gleb Savchenko are still going strong? Share your own thoughts and ideas in the comments below.
Keep following TV Shows Ace online to keep up with Gleb and the rest of the DWTS cast.
